name: Slow-Roasted Salmon Salad with Lemon-Dill Aioli
description: Incredibly tender, flaky, and moist slow-roasted salmon, perfect for a high-end salad. All components are prepped on Sunday for quick and easy weekday assembly.

ingredients.name: Large Lemon
ingredients.notes: Zest and juice needed for aioli

instructions: Sunday Prep (Salmon): Preheat oven to 275°F (135°C). Place salmon on a baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil, and season liberally with salt and pepper. Roast for 20-30 minutes until it flakes easily. Cool completely, then gently flake into large pieces and divide among 5 airtight containers.

Sunday Prep (Aioli): In a bowl, mix mayonnaise, the zest and juice of one lemon, chopped dill, chopped capers, and freshly ground black pepper. Divide this mixture into 5 small, sealed condiment containers.
Sunday Prep (The Crunch): Finely dice the celery and shallot. Divide this mixture among 5 small bags or containers.

Sunday Prep (Pickled Onions): Thinly slice the red onion and pack it into a jar. In a saucepan, bring apple cider vinegar, water, sugar, and 1 tsp salt to a simmer. Pour the hot liquid over the onions. Let cool, then refrigerate. They will be ready in about an hour.
Sunday Prep (The Vehicle): Portion out crackers into 5 separate bags.
Weekday Assembly: To serve, grab one container of salmon, one aioli, and one bag of the celery/shallot mixture.
Weekday Assembly: Gently mix the salmon, aioli, and celery/shallot together in a bowl.
Weekday Assembly: Top with a desired amount of pickled red onions and serve with crackers.
cookNotes: Slow-roasting salmon at a low temperature yields an exceptionally moist and tender texture, perfect for salads.
Using a high-quality store-bought mayonnaise is a great shortcut for the lemon-dill aioli.
The quick-pickled red onions add a bright, acidic crunch and will last for several weeks in the refrigerator.
For the best texture and freshness, assemble the salad just before eating.
